text: (bright music)
- I am Gayla Beasley.
I am a Senior Program Manager.
I was in the United States Air Force,

so I was in the military
for a really long time,

and towards the end of my
military service, I figured,
oh my gosh, I still have to get a job.
So I went to grad school

and from grad school I
attended some recruiting fairs,

and I met a young lady who
said, "You gotta come with us.

The crew, well you
would love it to be us."
I was a little sketchy at first
but she was absolutely right,
I loved it.

And I told her she had
really great eyelashes.
So, that's how we got here.
I think people with a military background

would be very surprised how
well their skills translate.
You had to get a mission done.
You had to get a program moved.
You had to move a truck.

You had to get something
from point A to point B.
And that's very similar for AWS.
We get a goal and we get it done.

And I think in some ways,
people who are used to

very strict hierarchies would
actually really like it here,

because you're very
empowered to take initiative,
get stuff done at the lowest level,

get your project finished,
identify your resources,
so it's really fantastic.
As a Program Manager, my day-to-day role
changes just throughout day-to-day,

whether it's budget, scope,
and requirements testing,

identifying roadblocks,
escalating or necessary.

So, I'm working with
my software engineers,
my software engineering managers.
I work with our hardware engineers.
I work with data center folks.

So, it's different every
day but it can be very busy,
but also very fun.

I love when I'm able to
unblock a problem for someone.
So I, one of my superpowers
is I like soft skills, I love talking.

I'm very, if you haven't
told, I'm very chatty.
I like working with other people.

So anytime I can unblock
a problem for someone,

by putting 'em in touch
with the right person

or finding out the right
piece for information,
that's a good day for me.
Amazon's very dog friendly.

I have three dogs. I have to
shop them out all the time.

So, if you're into dogs,
this is the place for you.

And if you're just really
into innovation and technology
I think you would really enjoy
and find a great home here at AWS.
(bright music plays out)
